title: How to Register a Device on Amazon

steps.title: Download and install either Prime Video, Prime Music, Kindle, or Alexa.
steps.content: Download and install either Prime Video, Prime Music, Kindle, or Alexa. You can get these apps free from the App store or the Google Play Store. For example, if you're on an iPhone but want to register that device with your Amazon account so you can access your books, you'll want to download and install the Kindle app.

steps.title: Open the Amazon app you downloaded.
steps.content: Open the Amazon app you downloaded. This can be either Prime Video, Prime Music, Kindle, or Alexa.

steps.title: Login to your Amazon account.
steps.content: Login to your Amazon account. Once you open the app, you’ll be prompted to log in to your account. That device is automatically linked and registered with your Amazon account. To manage your devices, navigate to your account menu, then “Content and Devices.” You can check here to see if you’ve successfully registered your device, and you can deregister when you don’t need it anymore.

steps.title: Tap the menu icon ⋮.
steps.content: Tap the menu icon ⋮ . Devices like the Kindle E-Reader have an Amazon account setting. Logging into your Amazon account there also registers your device. You’ll generally find this three-dot menu in the upper right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . You’ll see this near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Tap My account (newer generations) or Register (older generations).
steps.content: Tap My account (newer generations) or Register (older generations). This will take you to the Amazon account the E-Reader is registered with. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Register to sign in with your Amazon account.
steps.content: Tap Register to sign in with your Amazon account. To manage your devices, navigate to your account menu, then “Content and Devices.” You can check here to see if you’ve successfully registered your device, and you can deregister when you don’t need it anymore.

steps.title: Download and install the Prime Video app.
steps.content: Download and install the Prime Video app. You can find this in the Microsoft Store if you’re setting up an Xbox, for example, or the App Store if you’re using an AppleTV streaming media player.

steps.title: Choose “Register on Amazon Website.”
steps.content: Choose “Register on Amazon Website.” You’ll see a 5-6 character code. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Go to https://primevideo.com/ontv/devices and sign in to your Amazon account.
steps.content: Go to https://primevideo.com/ontv/devices and sign in to your Amazon account. That link will take you to a site where you can register your streaming media player (like AppleTV or Xbox console).

steps.title: Enter the 5-6 code you saw earlier.
steps.content: Enter the 5-6 code you saw earlier.

steps.title: Click Register Device.
steps.content: Click Register Device . If you get an error, you might have entered the code incorrectly. To manage your active devices, navigate to your account menu, then “Content and Devices.” You can check here to see if you’ve successfully registered your device, and you can deregister when you don’t need it anymore.
